intro: Lactuca tatarinowii, commonly known as Tatarian lettuce, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and can be either basal or alternate in arrangement. Lactuca tatarinowii is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
